main event: A USAF pilot and radar operator observed a stationary light at Misawa AFB in Japan that gradually changed color from white to reddish-orange and back, with the object also appearing on the radar scope of an F-94 aircraft.
interesting points: The radar contact gave weak and indistinct returns, and the object's altitude was estimated to be around 50,000 feet.
The pilot attempted to close on the object, but it disappeared from view at 35,000 feet.
The radar contact was intermittent, with the object exhibiting unusual horizontal-like movement and oscillation in direction from northeast to southeast.
The report concludes that the object was not a celestial object, aircraft, meteorite, guided missile/rocket, or balloon, and the sighting is classified as a UFO.
No physical evidence or photographs were available from the incident.
sighted object: a stationary light that changed color from white to reddish-orange and back
